triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the core technology enabling flexible deployment and high mobility for IoT data collection.

triples.name: Internet of things
triples.relevance: IoT is the target application domain where UAVs are used for collecting sensor data from connected devices.

triples.name: Emergency management
triples.relevance: Disaster management is cited as a key application area for UAV-assisted data collection.

triples.name: Wireless sensor network
triples.relevance: Sensor networks form the foundation of IoT systems, with clustering and data collection as core optimization problems.

triples.name: Data collection
triples.relevance: Data collection is the primary task addressed in the survey, specifically UAV-assisted approaches for gathering IoT sensor data.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: Sensor clustering is identified as a key technology for optimizing UAV-assisted data collection efficiency.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Joint path planning is a core technique discussed for optimizing UAV trajectories during data collection missions.

triples.name: Resource allocation
triples.relevance: Joint resource allocation is a key optimization problem in UAV-assisted IoT data collection systems.

triples.name: Channel access method
triples.relevance: Efficient multiple access is discussed as an open problem for coordinating communication in UAV-IoT data collection.

triples.name: Environmental monitoring
triples.relevance: Environmental monitoring is identified as a significant application area for UAV-assisted data collection.
